newsitem.title: USA: Citation sees Q2 up but below estimates.
newsitem.headline: Citation sees Q2 up but below estimates.

text.p: Citation Computer Systems Inc said Tuesday that it expects to report revenues and operating earnings for the second quarter that are above the year-ago period but short of analysts' expectations.

Citation, which makes comprehensive client/server information systems, said it expects earnings for the second quarter in the range of $0.09 to $0.12 a share. The earnings projection excludes a previously announced charge of $0.21 a share for restructuring and consolidation of its operations in the United Kingdom.
Citation earned $0.01 a share in the year-ago quarter.
Citation also said it expects revenues for the quarter ended September 30 of between $6.2 million and $6.4 million, an increase of 35 to 39 percent from a year ago.
A company spokesman said analysts have projected second quarter revenues of about $8.0 million and operating earnings, excluding the charge, in a range of $0.15 to $0.17 a share.

Citation said it filed a registration statement on July 16 with the Securities and Exchange Commission covering a proposed secondary common stock offering. The company said it will review market conditions over the next week to determine whether and when to go forward with that offering.
